[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Automated Diagnostics Tool (ADT) defines requirements for fault detection and diagnostics, ensuring accurate real-time and historical analysis.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ADT detects faults in chillers, cooling towers, and HVAC subsystems using automated analytics.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ADT integrates with sensors, storage, and analytics tools for fault detection.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ADT offers a Windows dashboard for monitoring and configuration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ADT operates on portable and fixed HVAC diagnostic platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ADT processes ASCII-formatted data and supports interoperability.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ADT ensures secure real-time data transmission.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ADT supports high-volume processing with optimized storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ADT ensures continuous fault detection with automatic failover mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: ADT adapts to diverse HVAC system configurations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ADT integrates with external analytics platforms for enhanced diagnostics.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ADT handles fault detection, diagnostics, and alerts.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for HVAC engineers and maintenance teams.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ADT depends on stable networks and HVAC data.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ADT requires HVAC protocol compliance and secure exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: HVAC: Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall connect to HVAC subsystems via standard protocols.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall validate real-time data inputs before analysis (REQ-FUNC-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall preprocess input data for diagnostics.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall detect faults in cooling towers and chillers.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall store diagnostic outputs for alerts and analysis.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide configurable fault detection thresholds.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall offer an intuitive interface with structured navigation.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process data within 2 seconds for fault detection.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall retrieve historical data within 5 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall maintain logs of input, processed, and diagnostic data.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall comply with ACID principles for reliable storage.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall operate exclusively on Windows-compatible platforms.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall support modular plug-and-play diagnostics.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO/IEC 27001 for secure diagnostics.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale for varying data loads.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log all events for compliance and debugging (REQ-COMP-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-003: The system shall ensure 99.9% uptime with failover mechanisms.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Diagnostics verified via unit, integration, and performance tests.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and troubleshooting guides.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO/IEC standards, HVAC protocols, and diagnostic tool best practices.
